discussion.content:
Risk planning involves identifying potential risk events that could occur during the
project, determining their probability of occurrence, and determining their impact on the
project. Probability is always expressed as a number between 0.0 and 1.0. Risk response
plans should be developed for those risks that have a high probability of occurrence, have
a significant impact on the project if they occur, or have an overall risk score that is high. (Comptia Project+ Study Guide, 2nd ed.)

questions.question_text:
A project team is identifying, rating the probability of, and determining the impact on potential problems throughout the project. The team is also including the corresponding actions to take.
Which of the following activities does this describe?

A manufacturer is developing a product that will start in one week. The product has a delivery deadline of 90 days.
Which of the following characteristics classifies this as a project?

discussion.content: This question is worded very poorly. I believe it intends to say that a "project" will start and and not a product. Given this, I believe the answer is incorrect. Projects are not iterative although working through a project can be. The correct answer is D - Temporary.

You have to twist your brain, but I can see how it can be Iterative. "developing" is the key. 
https://asana.com/resources/iterative-process 

It's yet another terrible question with minimal context.
D. Temporary - since it starts and has a deadline.
Nothing in this question states that it would be iterative. It does state that it is temporary, which is one of the characteristics of a project.

You can use an iterative waterfall approach that will
reduce risk by completing components of work in a given time frame (Comptia Project+ Study Gude, 2nd ed.)
